summary: This is an email chain between attorneys regarding the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell. The correspondence, dated October 2021, involves prosecutors from the Southern District of New York and defense attorneys from WilmerHale discussing the identification of a JPMorgan witness for trial and the provision of a trial appearance subpoena.

persons.name: Allison Stoddart
persons.context: An attorney at WilmerHale corresponding with prosecutors about identifying a JPMorgan witness and obtaining a trial subpoena for the Ghislaine Maxwell case.

persons.name: Alison
persons.context: A prosecutor from the Southern District of New York corresponding with defense counsel about facilitating a conversation to identify an appropriate witness from JPMorgan for the Maxwell trial.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, which is the subject of the legal correspondence.

connections.description: Corresponding as defense attorney (Stoddart) and prosecutor (Alison) regarding witness identification and subpoena matters for the Ghislaine Maxwell trial.
Both are attorneys at the law firm WilmerHale and are copied on the same emails regarding the Maxwell case.
Alison is an Assistant U.S. Attorney prosecuting the case against defendant Ghislaine Maxwell.
Allison Stoddart is an attorney at WilmerHale, which is involved in the Maxwell case, likely representing a party with an interest, such as JPMorgan.

events.title: Email regarding JPMorgan witness identification
events.description: Allison Stoddart follows up on a previous discussion, stating JPMorgan is working on identifying a witness for trial and requests a trial appearance subpoena from prosecutors.

events.title: Prosecutor sends documents regarding JPMorgan witness
events.description: Prosecutor Alison sends a zip file containing draft exhibits to facilitate a conversation about identifying an appropriate witness from JPMorgan for the Ghislaine Maxwell trial.

locations: 7 World Trade Center, 250 Greenwich Street, New York, NY 10007

keyFacts: The document is legal correspondence from October 2021 related to the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell.
JPMorgan is involved in the case, with attorneys working to identify a witness from the bank for the trial.
Prosecutors from the Southern District of New York are communicating with defense attorneys from WilmerHale regarding witness preparation and subpoenas.
The email chain shows coordination between the prosecution and defense on procedural matters for the Maxwell trial.
